Package org.cesecore.certificates.crl

Class RevokedCertInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.crl.RevokedCertInfo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class RevokedCertInfo
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Holds information about a revoked certificate. The information kept here is the information that goes into a CRLEntry.
    Version:
    $Id: RevokedCertInfo.java 34193 2020-01-07 15:18:15Z samuellb $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getReason

        public int getReason()
        The reason the certificate was revoked. 
         ReasonFlags ::= BIT STRING {
    unspecified(0),
    keyCompromise(1),
    cACompromise(2),
    affiliationChanged(3),
    superseded(4),
    cessationOfOperation(5),
    certficateHold(6)
    removeFromCRL(8)
    privilegeWithdrawn(9)
    aACompromise(10)
 }
        Returns:
        reason
        See Also:
        REVOCATION_REASON_UNSPECIFIED

      • setReason

      • isRevoked

        public boolean isRevoked()
        A quick way to tell if the certificate has been revoked.
        Returns:
        true if the certificate has been revoked, otherwise false.

      • isPermanentlyRevoked

        public boolean isPermanentlyRevoked()
        Returns:
        true if the certificate is permanently revoked (i.e. revoked and not just "on hold")

      • getHumanReadableReason

        public String getHumanReadableReason()
        This method returns the revocation reason as a text string that is understandable. TODO: The strings in the enum should be easier for users to change, used from "publicweb/retrieve/check_status_result.jsp"
        Returns:
        A string describing the reason for revocation.

      • mergeByDateAndStatus

        public static Collection<RevokedCertInfo> mergeByDateAndStatus​(Collection<RevokedCertInfo> a,
                                                               Collection<RevokedCertInfo> b,
                                                               long lastBaseCrlDate)
        Merges two collections of RevokedCertInfo. Note that the parameters are slightly different. Duplicates are removed according to these rules:
        • Older permanent status changes win over newer ones
        • Permanent status changes always win over temporary ones ("on hold" / "re-activate")
        • More recent temporary status changes win over older ones
        Parameters:
        a - First collection of RevokedCertInfo. May not contain duplicates for the same serial number.
        b - Second collection of RevokedCertInfo. May contain duplicates
        lastBaseCrlDate - Entries in unrevoked state will only be included if they are more recent than this date. (<= 0 means never include them)
        Returns:
        CompressionCollection of certificates. May simply be a reference to a if b is empty, or a new merged CompressedCollection with any duplicates removed.
